Sentencas: The plasma spraying process has been proven capable of fabricating high-performance metal -supported solid oxide fuel cells (MS-SOFCs), and the critical technology is to prepare dense MS-SOFC electrolytes.
Titulo: Low-pressure plasma sprayed dense scandia-stabilized zirconia electrolyte and its effect on SOFC performance

Sentencas: Usually, very low-pressure plasma spraying (<1000 Pa) is adopted as it can significantly improve the electrolyte density and air tightness.
Titulo: Low-pressure plasma sprayed dense scandia-stabilized zirconia electrolyte and its effect on SOFC performance

Sentencas: However, at the same time, it also has the disadvantages of low deposition efficiency and high cost.
Titulo: Low-pressure plasma sprayed dense scandia-stabilized zirconia electrolyte and its effect on SOFC performance

Sentencas: This paper explores whether it is possible to prepare dense MS-SOFC electrolytes under low-pressure conditions (1000-10000 Pa) with ideal deposition efficiency and cost.
Titulo: Low-pressure plasma sprayed dense scandia-stabilized zirconia electrolyte and its effect on SOFC performance

Sentencas: Specifically, 4000 Pa and 7000 Pa were chosen to prepare scandia-stabilized zirconia (ScSZ) electrolytes.
Titulo: Low-pressure plasma sprayed dense scandia-stabilized zirconia electrolyte and its effect on SOFC performance

Sentencas: The effects of spraying pressure and distance on the electrolyte microstructure and cell electrochemical performance were investigated.
Titulo: Low-pressure plasma sprayed dense scandia-stabilized zirconia electrolyte and its effect on SOFC performance

Sentencas: It was found that the electrolyte prepared at a pressure of 4000 Pa and a spraying distance of 325 mm had the lowest porosity of 3.28%.
Titulo: Low-pressure plasma sprayed dense scandia-stabilized zirconia electrolyte and its effect on SOFC performance

Sentencas: Meanwhile, the cell exhibited the best electrochemical performance with an open circuit voltage of 1.008 V and a maximum power density of 970 mW/cm(2) at 800 degree celsius.
Titulo: Low-pressure plasma sprayed dense scandia-stabilized zirconia electrolyte and its effect on SOFC performance
